wikipedia_page.main:
Silas Hardy (30 April 1867 – 27 June 1905) was an English cricketer.  Hardy was a right-arm fast-medium bowler, although which hand he batted with is unknown.  He was born in Ilkeston, Derbyshire.
Hardy made his first-class debut for Nottinghamshire against Kent in 1893 County Championship.  From 1893 to 1895, he represented the county in 5 first-class matches, the last of which came against Derbyshire in the 1895 County Championship.  In his 5 first-class matches, he scored 45 runs at a batting average of 9.00, with a high score of 12*.  With the ball he took 4 wickets at a bowling average of 68.50, with best figures of 2/100.He died at Kimberley, Nottinghamshire on 27 June 1905.
